intro: Galium abaujense subsp. vertesense, commonly known as the Vertes gall. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant typically has opposite, simple, and hairy leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, often blooming in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Central Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides.
